description: Borrowed from Medieval Latin contrōvertere, from Latin contrō- (“against”) + vertere (“to turn”).

verbs.description: controvert (third-person singular simple present controverts, present participle controverting, simple past and past participle controverted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To dispute, to argue about (something). [from 16th c.]
(transitive) To argue against (something or someone); to contradict, to deny. [from 16th c.]
(intransitive) To be involved or engaged in controversy; to argue. [from 17th c.]
